name: Telegraph's Pompadour
description: The golden-colored libation pairs two kinds of rum with an ages-old French aperitif called Pineau des Charentes. It harbors deep, burnt-sugar flavors while remaining light, refreshing, and summery.
recipeIngredient: 1 1/2 ounces J. Navarre Pineau des Charentes Rosé
1 ounce dark rum, such as El Dorado 5-year
1/2 ounce blanc rhum agricole, such as Neisson
Dash Bittermens Xocolatl Mole bitters (see note)

recipeInstructions.text: Add Pineau des Charentes, dark rum, rhum agricole, and bitters to a mixing glass filled with ice and stir until chilled. Strain into a tall ice-filled serving glass. Squeeze lemon twist over cocktail to express oils and drop into glass. Serve.
